ECS: Entity Component System. The base architecture of Hytale. Entities are just IDs, components contain data, and systems process logic by filtering through components.
Component: Data container attached to an Entity. Examples: TransformComponent, HealthComponent. In Hytale Prism, they can be identified by inheriting from the Component interface.
System: Pure logic that processes entities with specific components. They run on the server and usually have methods like onEntityAdded or tick.
Teleport: Component and system responsible for moving entities safely between worlds or coordinates, managing chunk loading.
World: Abstraction layer representing a universe/dimension. Contains the EntityStore and allows for block and entity management.
EntityStore: World repository that indexes and manages all active entities. Allows searches by proximity or volume (AABB/Box).
Prefab: Data template defining an entity or structure. Includes components, their default values, and asset configurations.
VFX: Visual effects processed by the rendering engine. In code, they are usually managed through VFXComponent or particle systems.
Interaction: System managing communication between players and world objects. Based on PickupItemInteraction or UseBlockEvent.
